timeline.bodyText:
What does the renaming fix? If it really fixes something, please add the directory to

  
    
      skywalking/tools/coverage/report.sh
    
    
        Lines 32 to 34
      in
      8e6a527
    
    
    
    

        
          
           sudo rm -rf "${JACOCO_HOME}"/classes/"${exec_data}"/org/apache/skywalking/oap/server/core/query/entity || true 
        

        
          
           sudo rm -rf "${JACOCO_HOME}"/classes/"${exec_data}"/org/apache/skywalking/testcase || true 
        

        
          
           sudo rm -rf "${JACOCO_HOME}"/classes/"${exec_data}"/org/apache/skywalking/e2e || true 
        
    
  


i.e. sudo rm -rf "${JACOCO_HOME}"/classes/"${exec_data}"/test || true
timeline.author: kezhenxu94

replies.bodyText: So the package name rules need to be updated too, is the renaming a must?
replies.author: kezhenxu94

replies.bodyText: Use the org.apache.skywalking package prefix, then the SpringMVC plugin cannot be enhanced, because that package is ignored. So avoid using this package.
replies.author: mrproliu

replies.bodyText: @kezhenxu94  I seem the e2e also has the style check, and It's must match the package name with regex, ^org\.apache\.skywalking(\.[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9]*)+$, so how can I fix that?
replies.author: mrproliu

replies.bodyText:
Use the org.apache.skywalking package prefix, then the SpringMVC plugin cannot be enhanced, because that package is ignored. So avoid using this package.

Then you need to:

update the package name rules:


  
    
      skywalking/apm-checkstyle/checkStyle.xml
    
    
         Line 99
      in
      dcd66ee
    
    
    
    

        
          
           <property name="format" value="^org\.apache\.skywalking(\.[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9]*)+$"/> 
        
    
  



add the package to exclusion list


  
    
      skywalking/tools/coverage/report.sh
    
    
        Lines 32 to 34
      in
      8e6a527
    
    
    
    

        
          
           sudo rm -rf "${JACOCO_HOME}"/classes/"${exec_data}"/org/apache/skywalking/oap/server/core/query/entity || true 
        

        
          
           sudo rm -rf "${JACOCO_HOME}"/classes/"${exec_data}"/org/apache/skywalking/testcase || true 
        

        
          
           sudo rm -rf "${JACOCO_HOME}"/classes/"${exec_data}"/org/apache/skywalking/e2e || true 
        
    
  


i.e. sudo rm -rf "${JACOCO_HOME}"/classes/"${exec_data}"/test || true
replies.author: kezhenxu94

replies.bodyText: I think test.apache.skywalking package is used in the spring plugin test too.
replies.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText:
I think test.apache.skywalking package is used in the spring plugin test too.

Yes.
replies.author: mrproliu

I have changed, please take a look.

timeline.message: move back to the org.apache.skywalking prefix, only profile e2e move to test.apache.skywalking
